intro: Hieracium petrogenum, commonly known as the purple meadowhawk, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, preferring moist, well-drained soils. Its flowers are yellow with purple markings, and it produces achenes as its seeds. Hieracium petrogenum is often found in open habitats and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
